issues.description: The problem statement UML and the solution expect a Stock method named addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient), but the template repository's Stock class provides addItem(StockIngredient) instead. This name/signature mismatch across artifacts means students following the UML or the problem description will try to call addToStockIngredients and get a compile error when using the provided template. Conversely, students who call addItem will see the solution use a different method name, which is confusing and may break automated checks that expect the UML-described API.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the API consistent across artifacts. Either (A) change the template Stock class to provide addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) (it can delegate to the existing addItem implementation), or (B) update the problem statement and the solution to reference addItem(StockIngredient) instead of addToStockIngredients. The simplest student-friendly fix is to add an addToStockIngredients method to the template that calls addItem, ensuring both the UML/spec and template compile and match the solution.

issues.description: The problem statement's UML and the solution use the method name addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) on Stock, but the template repository defines this functionality as addItem(StockIngredient). This naming mismatch can confuse students: the exercise description (and reference solution) expects addToStockIngredients while the starter code exposes addItem, so students may search for or attempt to implement the wrong method name when wiring up supply handling (acceptSupplyDelivery) and adding new StockIngredient objects.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the template with the problem and solution by renaming the template method addItem(StockIngredient) to addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient). Alternatively, add a forwarding method addToStockIngredients that delegates to addItem so both names exist, and update any references in starter code or tests to use the canonical name from the UML (addToStockIngredients).
